column4: hi, is there a way how can I debug, or log somehow a problem with booting of grub? a problem occured to me. I have dual-boot configured in there, one for linux, which works fine without a problem, and the second - windows xp, suddenly stopped to start the boot. but when i change the boot sequence in the BIOS, it works just fine, but when switching it back to the drive with grub, then it simply won't start booting of the windows, and I can't find why.
thx
Maybe fixmbr or something like that, fix grub might also be it.
why fixmbr? as i know, i haven't screwed up anything
I found computerhope.com to be a great how to and stuff for windows
but as i've said before, when i change the boot sequence in bios to the drive with windows to be first, it works fine. so there isn't a problem with the windows itself.
__84572: The MBR could have been corrupted when in BIOS, oh wait, two physical drives?
yes, two phys. drives

Ok, that is a bit different, sorta. If both HDDs have a Master Loader, or Boot Loader then that can cause confusion, it usually does not with GRUB and WinMBR , but it can, let me search the forums and see if I can find the solution.
ok, thx
_8472: What version Ubuntu?
_8472: Maybe here> http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1179587&highlight=dual+boot
9.04, the JJ
_8472: Ok, let me try that again, I think that forum thread was win7, but should work on any, http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1179587&highlight=dual+boot
thx, i'm going to try now something, and i'll see then. hope some changes might work. thx again
Also this one has been a great one: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=179902
problem solved, it was a wrong definition of drive in my menu.lst, thx for the help
That makes me happy, any errors that you sole please post to launchpad or the forums, :)
*solve
actually, there wasn't any error, it simply didn't booted from the wrong drive
Now that is fun stuff!
ok, thx again, bye
I still enjoy learning things, and mistakes are part of the human condition.
